intro: Orophea ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf star-apple, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its striking, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces showy, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by fleshy, orange-red berries. Orophea ovalifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant foliage and unique floral display. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
